summary: A fun philosophy app showcasing 'Cash's Famous Philosophy' — a collection of humorous, nonsensical, and surprisingly thought-provoking quotes and observations, such as 'If an orange is called an orange, why is an apple not called a red?' and 'Your tongue knows what everything tastes like.'
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- A quirky hand-drawn style banner illustration featuring abstract swirling thought bubbles, question marks, fruits (orange and apple), and a tongue, rendered in warm amber and cream tones on a deep brown background (philosophy-banner.dim_1200x300.png)

existing_features.title: Build a browsable frontend that displays Cash's philosophy quotes fetched from the backend. Each quote should be presented as its own card or panel. Users can scroll or navigate through the collection.

Apply a bold, irreverent visual theme — think late-night diner meets philosophical manifesto. Use warm, earthy tones (amber, cream, deep brown) with chunky serif or slab typography, hand-drawn-style accents, and a slightly chaotic but charming layout that matches the absurdist humor of the quotes. Enforce this style consistently across all pages and components.

new_feature_requests.summary: Display a collection of Cash's famous philosophy quotes in a fun, browsable UI
Include iconic example quotes like 'If an orange is called an orange, why is an apple not called a red?' and 'Your tongue knows what everything tastes like.'

Store a collection of Cash's philosophy quotes in the backend. Seed it with at least these two quotes: 'If an orange is called an orange, why is an apple not called a red?' and 'Your tongue knows what everything tastes like.' Support querying all quotes.
